title: Mackenzie Shirilla July 31, 2022 Crash – Bodycam, Dashcam, and Police Reports

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Mackenzie Shirilla July 31, 2022 Crash – Bodycam, Dashcam, and Police Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Ohio Public Records Act, I am requesting all unedited and unaltered body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, and in-car camera footage in the possession of the Strongsville Police Department related to the July 31, 2022 incident at 11792 Alameda Drive involving Mackenzie Shirilla, Dominic Russo, and Davion Flanagan.

This request includes:
- All recordings from the crash scene
- Any officer interactions with the involved parties
- Footage of the arrest and transport of Mackenzie Shirilla
- Related dispatch audio, if available
- All police incident reports, investigative reports, supplemental reports, and case narratives connected to this incident

I request the files and documents be provided electronically via a secure download link or as PDF files. If there are any fees for fulfilling this request, please inform me in advance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Abdul Rehman Anjum

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Mackenzie Shirilla July 31, 2022 Crash – Bodycam, Dashcam, and Police Reports
communications.communication:
Hello,

This is already available on our Public Portal. Click ‘SEARCH ARCHIVE’ then click ‘SEARCH.’ You’ll see it in the list.
If that does not work for some reason, click here:

https://strongsville.justfoia.com/publicportal/requests?formId&requestDateStart&requestDateEnd&sortBy=viewCount&descending=true&page=1&pageSize=10


Thank you,
Kim
Strongsville Redactions
440-580-3252

title: Local level SAEC policies/data (Lyndonville Village Police Department)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Law Request: Local level SAEC policies/data (Lyndonville Village Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (1977 N.Y. Laws ch. 933), I hereby request the following records:

Any and all statistics, data, reports, audits, policies, and procedures pertaining to the following items regarding sexual assault evidence collection (SAEC) kits (also known as "rape kits") and processing:

• all standard operating procedures regarding the SAEC process

• any written policies or procedures regarding department practices on the acquisition of or handling of rape kit evidence, including protocols for its collection, testing, and delegation and transfer to all other possibly relevant locations, laboratories, or agencies

• the number of kits collected and booked into evidence from the period of January 1, 2000 through the date this request is processed

• the number of kits that have been processed by a public or private crime or forensic laboratory or equivalent processing location from the period of January 1, 2000 through the date this request is processed

• the number of unprocessed kits in any storage facilities currently under the department’s jurisdiction and control, including those held by medical personnel or at external laboratory locations

• any materials regarding the status or ultimate disposition of cases in which a kit was collected. Please include all available segregable data.

• all audits involving this agency regarding the collection or backlog of SAEC kits

• all proposed alterations or yet-to-be-implemented changes to the policies and procedures regarding the collection, testing, and use of SAEC kits

If there any questions about this request, please feel free to call us at the MuckRock office at 617-299-1832.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Vanessa Nason

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Law Request: Local level SAEC policies/data (Lyndonville Village Police Department)
communications.communication: Ms.  Nason – In reference to your FOIL request dated Thursday, August 17, 2017, the subject line references the Lyndonville Village Police Department and the starting greeting of your request states Sheriff Department.  Please confirm if this request is in fact for the Orleans County Sheriff’s Department or the Lyndonville Village Police Department as we are two different law enforcement agencies.  – Nicole
An interim response, stating the request is being processed.

files.title: Interim Response
files.source: Sheriff Department

title: VMI Student activities permits

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Student activities permits
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Discussion during the recent VMI Executive Committe session and in the letter submitted during the public comment period for that session there are repeated references to "permits" in regard to The Cadet newspaper and other activities. During the BOV Maj Gen. Wins stated all "permits" were consistant and in response to Mr. Williams' question on The Cadet Maj. Gen. Wins stated the permit for that organization woulld follow the same model as for other student activities. It was also stated that VMI does not "negotiate" there permits.

I am requesting a copy of all non-athletic student activity "permits" now in effect for student organizations at VMI.  Per the VMI website these include: Arnold Air Society, Aviation Club, Ballroom Dancing, Building Bridges, Coast Guard, Ducks Unlimited, Emergency Response Team, Equestrian, Fire Fighting, Fishing, Glee, Golf, Ethics, Internationa, Jiu-Jitsu, Men In Grey, Motivation, Pistol, Promaji, Ranger, Recon Commpany, Rock Climbing, Scuba, Cadet Life-Holding Account, Cadet Program Board, Coast Guard Club/Naval ROTC, Combat Support Group/Military Skills Group, The Bomb, Theater, Three Gun, Timber Framers, Trap and Skeet, Status Check/Podcast Club, VMI's scholarly journal "Cadence", American Campaigning Warefare, and any others not listed on the website.

I am also requesting a copy of records showing how much non-VMI money each of the student activities received for any outside source and the source of those funds for the current academic year that is in addition to the VMI unds I assume are accurate on this published document. https://www.vmi.edu/media/content-assets/documents/comptroller/Cadet-Activity-Fees-2024-2025.pdf (if not please correct).

Given Maj. Gen. Wins' statement the permit for The Cadet was reviewed against all other permits during its drafting these shoudl be immediately available with little to no search required.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request #24-73
communications.communication:
Thank you. In review ing the documents I found some of the  records I requested are missing.

1. Per my original request: "I am also requesting a copy of records showing how much non-VMI money each of the student activities received for any outside source and the source of those funds for the current academic year that is in addition to the VMI funds I assume are accurate on this published document. https://www.vmi.edu/media/content-assets/documents/comptroller/Cadet-Activity-Fees-2024-2025.pdf (if not please correct)." You did not provide anything on additional funds they received and from what sources.

2.  I did not see any permits for the establishment and operations of the following: American Campaigning Warefare Club, Ballroom Dancing Club, Coast Guard Club, Ducks uUnlimited, Emercency Response Team, Fishing Club, Lacross Club, International Club, Men in Grey, Motivation Club, Newman Society, Promaji Club, Ranger Club (same as Ranger Challenge?), Recon Club, Scuba Club, Status Check/Podcast Club, The Bomb (yearbook), VMI Theater, Three Gun Club, Timber Framers Club, Trap and Skeet Club. - These are listed on the VMI website and some have their own social media but I did not see any Permits for them to exist or operate in the records provided so far. They all also have funds allocated to them by the published online budget so I assume they have a permit to both exist and operate.

3. I did not see any standing or other permits for NCAA teams to include the privileges of NCAA teams receive and these are cadet activities.

Thank you in advance for providing these apparently missing records responsive to my request.

title: Shooting Targets (Phoenix Police Department)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Shooting Targets (Phoenix Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the purchase and use of targets used for marksmanship training:

Targets are defined as paper and metal targets used by the department for shooting lethal and nonlethal weapons (40mm foam rounds, tasers, etc). They can be stationary or moving. 

Purchase and invoice records for targets
Scans, photos, website links, and any record that shows what the targets look like

Search 2018 to today’s date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Re: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Shooting Targets (Phoenix Police Department)
communications.communication:
Hello,

We have received your request at Public Records. We will process your request accordingly, and a service request ID number, otherwise known as a tracking number, will be provided to you via email when the request is entered into our system. The service request ID number starts with PPD-PR followed by 10-digits. Request made to Public Records are processed in the order they are received, so we appreciate your patience during this process. title: Seattle City Conucil - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Seattle City Conucil - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
communications.communication:
January 12, 2025

 via email to LEGPDR@seattle.gov

Seattle City Council - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
 
To whom it may concern,

RCW 40.14.026(5)

“To improve best practices for dissemination of public records, each agency with actual staff and legal costs associated with fulfilling public records requests of at least one hundred thousand dollars during the prior fiscal year must… report to the joint legislative audit and review committee by July 1st of each subsequent year the following metrics, measured over the preceding year:

RCW 40.14.026(5)(l)

(l) The estimated costs incurred by the agency in fulfilling records requests, including costs for staff compensation and legal review, and a measure of the average cost per request;

RCW 40.14.026(5)(o)

(o) The costs incurred by the agency with managing and retaining records, including staff compensation and purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests;

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) detailing costs incurred by your agency in fulfilling records requests, including staff compensation, legal review, and any public records related litigation costs and/or legal settlements for the year 2024 and complete copies of all records request realted fee payments paid to your agency in 2024.

Responsive public records should include but are not limited to:

Supplies and services external services (e.g., printing services, large format printing) Mailing costs, supplies (CDs, DVDs, USB sticks, etc.) Staff compensation and benefit records, copies of payments of Public Records Fees Collected, Software licensing, public records portal and database software licensing and costs, purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests, professional services Agency staff costs, copies of billing for all Legal costs – including copies of all litigation Legal settlements related to public records requests litigation of any kind and copies of costs for staff time associated with invoicing and collection.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

Constructive Notice: Any and all communication(s) received on behalf of your agency in reference to this Public Records Request (RCW 42.45) from any unauthorized for-profit 3rd party company doing business outside the State of Washington will be the subject of a new public records request to your agency as to the origin and purpose of the communication as well as the identity of the sender of the communication.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

EMAIL RECORDS

Please provide any and all email records in NATIVE .pst electronic format.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Seattle City Conucil - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 13, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Seattle City Conucil - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
communications.communication:
Hello,

This email acknowledges your public disclosure request received on January 13, 2025 about the JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024.

This request was forwarded to us from the Legislative Department as we provide the JLARC report.

We understand the specific request to be as follows:

“Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:


  1.  Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) detailing costs incurred by your agency in fulfilling records requests, including staff compensation, legal review, and any public records related litigation costs and/or legal settlements for the year 2024 and complete copies of all records request realted fee payments paid to your agency in 2024.


Responsive public records should include but are not limited to:
Supplies and services external services (e.g., printing services, large format printing) Mailing costs, supplies (CDs, DVDs, USB sticks, etc.) Staff compensation and benefit records, copies of payments of Public Records Fees Collected, Software licensing, public records portal and database software licensing and costs, purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests, professional services Agency staff costs, copies of billing for all Legal costs – including copies of all litigation Legal settlements related to public records requests litigation of any kind and copies of costs for staff time associated with invoicing and collection.”

We have not yet begun compiling the 2024 JLARC report.  That is usually done in the Spring as the report is usually due in the Summer.  We can however provide copies of all invoices sent in 2024, the report we use to inform our responses to the JLARC report, the contracts for the systems we use to track and prepare responses for public disclosure requests, and any litigation settlements.

Please clarify what type of records you are seeking in regards to staff compensation and benefit records.

We understand that you do not wish to communicate or receive records via GovQA.  However, this is the system we use to administratively manage and retain public records requests so this request will be entered and tracked there and we will provide you that number.
With that said, we will continue to communicate with you via email including providing invoices.  Please note that you may receive notifications automatically generated by GovQA; you can ignore those.

We do not provide records via email or by uploading to 3rd party cloud storage.  If you do not want to use the GovQA portal, we can provide records via City provided CD/DVD, thumb drive, or portable hard drive.  Please review MDAR 17-0001<https://clerk.seattle.gov/search/results?s1=mdar&s3=&s2=&s4=&Sect4=AND&l=200&Sect2=THESON&Sect3=PLURON&Sect5=CFCF1&Sect6=HITOFF&d=CFCF&p=1&u=%2F~public%2Fcfcf1.htm&r=2&f=G> for the costs associated.  The costs for this will be invoiced and must be paid before we can release the records.
Please let us know how you would like to receive your records.

You may pay for your records by a check if you do not wish to make use of the online payment option provided by GovQA.

If you wish us to use these alternative means of receiving records, please let us know what address we should send them to or we will use the address provided:

MuckRock News
DEPT MR 179630
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

You have also requested that we provide any responsive emails in .pst format, but the software that we use to review documents does not export in that format. We can provide the emails in their native .msg format.

We will have our first installment ready on or before February 17, 2025.

Sincerely,

Citywide Public Records Act Program
City of Seattle

On Jan. 17, 2025:
Subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Seattle City Conucil - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
Hello,
This email acknowledges your public disclosure request received on January 13, 2025 about the JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024.
This request was forwarded to us from the Legislative Department as we provide the JLARC report.
We understand the specific request to be as follows:
“Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:
  1.  Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) detailing costs incurred by your agency in fulfilling records requests, including staff compensation, legal review, and any public records related litigation costs and/or legal settlements for the year 2024 and complete copies of all records request realted fee payments paid to your agency in 2024.
Responsive public records should include but are not limited to:
Supplies and services external services (e.g., printing services, large format printing) Mailing costs, supplies (CDs, DVDs, USB sticks, etc.) Staff compensation and benefit records, copies of payments of Public Records Fees Collected, Software licensing, public records portal and database software licensing and costs, purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests, professional services Agency staff costs, copies of billing for all Legal costs – including copies of all litigation Legal settlements related to public records requests litigation of any kind and copies of costs for staff time associated with invoicing and collection.”
We have not yet begun compiling the 2024 JLARC report.  That is usually done in the Spring as the report is usually due in the Summer.  We can however provide copies of all invoices sent in 2024, the report we use to inform our responses to the JLARC report, the contracts for the systems we use to track and prepare responses for public disclosure requests, and any litigation settlements.
Please clarify what type of records you are seeking in regards to staff compensation and benefit records.
We understand that you do not wish to communicate or receive records via GovQA.  However, this is the system we use to administratively manage and retain public records requests so this request will be entered and tracked there and we will provide you that number.
With that said, we will continue to communicate with you via email including providing invoices.  Please note that you may receive notifications automatically generated by GovQA; you can ignore those.
We do not provide records via email or by uploading to 3rd party cloud storage.  If you do not want to use the GovQA portal, we can provide records via City provided CD/DVD, thumb drive, or portable hard drive.  Please review MDAR 17-0001 for the costs associated.  The costs for this will be invoiced and must be paid before we can release the records.
Please let us know how you would like to receive your records.
You may pay for your records by a check if you do not wish to make use of the online payment option provided by GovQA.
If you wish us to use these alternative means of receiving records, please let us know what address we should send them to or we will use the address provided:
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 179630
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115
You have also requested that we provide any responsive emails in .pst format, but the software that we use to review documents does not export in that format. We can provide the emails in their native .msg format.
We will have our first installment ready on or before February 17, 2025.
Sincerely,
Citywide Public Records Act Program
City of Seattle
---
On Jan. 12, 2025:
Subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Seattle City Conucil - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
January 12, 2025
 via email to LEGPDR@seattle.gov
Seattle City Council - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024

To whom it may concern,
RCW 40.14.026(5)
“To improve best practices for dissemination of public records, each agency with actual staff and legal costs associated with fulfilling public records requests of at least one hundred thousand dollars during the prior fiscal year must… report to the joint legislative audit and review committee by July 1st of each subsequent year the following metrics, measured over the preceding year:
RCW 40.14.026(5)(l)
(l) The estimated costs incurred by the agency in fulfilling records requests, including costs for staff compensation and legal review, and a measure of the average cost per request;
RCW 40.14.026(5)(o)
(o) The costs incurred by the agency with managing and retaining records, including staff compensation and purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests;
PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56
Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:
1. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) detailing costs incurred by your agency in fulfilling records requests, including staff compensation, legal review, and any public records related litigation costs and/or legal settlements for the year 2024 and complete copies of all records request realted fee payments paid to your agency in 2024.
Responsive public records should include but are not limited to:
Supplies and services external services (e.g., printing services, large format printing) Mailing costs, supplies (CDs, DVDs, USB sticks, etc.) Staff compensation and benefit records, copies of payments of Public Records Fees Collected, Software licensing, public records portal and database software licensing and costs, purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests, professional services Agency staff costs, copies of billing for all Legal costs – including copies of all litigation Legal settlements related to public records requests litigation of any kind and copies of costs for staff time associated with invoicing and collection.
RECORDS INSTALLMENTS
If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first.
DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS
RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.
PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS
Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.
The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.
Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.
Constructive Notice: Any and all communication(s) received on behalf of your agency in reference to this Public Records Request (RCW 42.45) from any unauthorized for-profit 3rd party company doing business outside the State of Washington will be the subject of a new public records request to your agency as to the origin and purpose of the communication as well as the identity of the sender of the communication.
PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL
RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."
This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.
NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT
Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.
EMAIL RECORDS
Please provide any and all email records in NATIVE .pst electronic format.
FEES
In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.
EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)
Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.
EXEMPTION LOGS
Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.
COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION
The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.
COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL
Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.
Good Luck.

On Jan. 17, 2025: 
Subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Seattle City Conucil - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024 
Hello, 
This email acknowledges your public disclosure request received on January 13, 2025 about the JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024. 
This request was forwarded to us from the Legislative Department as we provide the JLARC report. 
We understand the specific request to be as follows: 
“Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records: 
1.  Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) detailing costs incurred by your agency in fulfilling records requests, including staff compensation, legal review, and any public records related litigation costs and/or legal settlements for the year 2024 and complete copies of all records request realted fee payments paid to your agency in 2024. 
Responsive public records should include but are not limited to: 
Supplies and services external services (e.g., printing services, large format printing) Mailing costs, supplies (CDs, DVDs, USB sticks, etc.) Staff compensation and benefit records, copies of payments of Public Records Fees Collected, Software licensing, public records portal and database software licensing and costs, purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests, professional services Agency staff costs, copies of billing for all Legal costs – including copies of all litigation Legal settlements related to public records requests litigation of any kind and copies of costs for staff time associated with invoicing and collection.” 
We have not yet begun compiling the 2024 JLARC report.  That is usually done in the Spring as the report is usually due in the Summer.  We can however provide copies of all invoices sent in 2024, the report we use to inform our responses to the JLARC report, the contracts for the systems we use to track and prepare responses for public disclosure requests, and any litigation settlements. 
Please clarify what type of records you are seeking in regards to staff compensation and benefit records. 
We understand that you do not wish to communicate or receive records via GovQA.  However, this is the system we use to administratively manage and retain public records requests so this request will be entered and tracked there and we will provide you that number. 
With that said, we will continue to communicate with you via email including providing invoices.  Please note that you may receive notifications automatically generated by GovQA; you can ignore those. 
We do not provide records via email or by uploading to 3rd party cloud storage.  If you do not want to use the GovQA portal, we can provide records via City provided CD/DVD, thumb drive, or portable hard drive.  Please review MDAR 17-0001 for the costs associated.  The costs for this will be invoiced and must be paid before we can release the records. 
Please let us know how you would like to receive your records. 
You may pay for your records by a check if you do not wish to make use of the online payment option provided by GovQA. 
If you wish us to use these alternative means of receiving records, please let us know what address we should send them to or we will use the address provided: 
MuckRock News 
DEPT MR 179630 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA 02115 
You have also requested that we provide any responsive emails in .pst format, but the software that we use to review documents does not export in that format. We can provide the emails in their native .msg format. 
We will have our first installment ready on or before February 17, 2025. 
Sincerely, 
Citywide Public Records Act Program 
City of Seattle 
--- 
On Jan. 12, 2025: 
Subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Seattle City Conucil - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024 
January 12, 2025 
via email to LEGPDR@seattle.gov 
Seattle City Council - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024 

To whom it may concern, 
RCW 40.14.026(5) 
“To improve best practices for dissemination of public records, each agency with actual staff and legal costs associated with fulfilling public records requests of at least one hundred thousand dollars during the prior fiscal year must… report to the joint legislative audit and review committee by July 1st of each subsequent year the following metrics, measured over the preceding year: 
RCW 40.14.026(5)(l) 
(l) The estimated costs incurred by the agency in fulfilling records requests, including costs for staff compensation and legal review, and a measure of the average cost per request; 
RCW 40.14.026(5)(o) 
(o) The costs incurred by the agency with managing and retaining records, including staff compensation and purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests; 
PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56 
Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records: 
1. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) detailing costs incurred by your agency in fulfilling records requests, including staff compensation, legal review, and any public records related litigation costs and/or legal settlements for the year 2024 and complete copies of all records request realted fee payments paid to your agency in 2024. 
Responsive public records should include but are not limited to: 
Supplies and services external services (e.g., printing services, large format printing) Mailing costs, supplies (CDs, DVDs, USB sticks, etc.) Staff compensation and benefit records, copies of payments of Public Records Fees Collected, Software licensing, public records portal and database software licensing and costs, purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests, professional services Agency staff costs, copies of billing for all Legal costs – including copies of all litigation Legal settlements related to public records requests litigation of any kind and copies of costs for staff time associated with invoicing and collection. 
RECORDS INSTALLMENTS 
If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first. 
DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS 
RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated. 
PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS 
Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints. 
The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link. 
Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service. 
Constructive Notice: Any and all communication(s) received on behalf of your agency in reference to this Public Records Request (RCW 42.45) from any unauthorized for-profit 3rd party company doing business outside the State of Washington will be the subject of a new public records request to your agency as to the origin and purpose of the communication as well as the identity of the sender of the communication. 
PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL 
RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records. 
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page." 
This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute. 
NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT 
Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production. 
EMAIL RECORDS 
Please provide any and all email records in NATIVE .pst electronic format. 
FEES 
In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act. 
EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA) 
Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included. 
EXEMPTION LOGS 
Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld. 
COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION 
The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 
COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL 
Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 
Good Luck. 
View request history, upload responsive documents, and report problems here: 
https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcity-council-219%252Fseattle-city-conucil-jlarc-2024-agency-costs-fulfilling-public-records-requests-including-litigation-for-the-year-2024-179630%252F%253Femail%253Dmuckrockseattle%252540mycusthelp.net&url_auth_token=AAAbJZGmT3P2zP3bJRwaBEZW1ME%3A1tjxNX%3AxGCFeJ8KSCCijD-b8Wf0mkcdkCmqKFM4osI3OnOvl9M 
If prompted for a passcode, please enter: 
KPBYUFRE 
Filed via MuckRock.com 
E-mail (Preferred): 179630-09990594@requests.muckrock.com 
PLEASE NOTE OUR NEW ADDRESS 
For mailed responses, please address (see note): 
MuckRock News 
DEPT MR 179630 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA 02115 
PLEASE NOTE: This request is not filed by a MuckRock staff member, but is being sent through MuckRock by the above in order to better track, share, and manage public records requests. Also note that improperly addressed (i.e., with the requester's name rather than "MuckRock News" and the department number) requests might be returned as undeliverable. 
We are closing this request as it is a continuation of C212861-012225. We will respond via email per your initial request and make note of this correspondence. 
If you have any follow-up questions or would like to initiate an administrative appeal under MDAR 17-0002 Section 6, please contact us within 10 business days, after which this request will no longer be monitored for communications. Judicial review of the Information Technology Department's response to C215723-021725 may be sought within one year of this letter, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Sincerely, 
Citywide Public Records Act Program 
City of Seattle

communications.subject: RE: C212861-012225 - RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Seattle City Conucil - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
communications.communication:
Hello,

We apologize for not sending an invoice to you on February 25, 2025 as we stated we would.  Unfortunately, our team was working through staffing changes. Because of this and because we did not hear back from you on the format you want to receive records, we are providing access via the GovQA portal and are waiving fees for this installment.  You will receive a notification from GovQA on how to access these records in a separate email, but I am also pasting them here:

To download your records, please:

  *   Navigate to the Public Records Request Center<https://city-seattle.mycusthelp.com/webapp/_rs/supporthome.aspx>.
  *   Select 'My Records Request Center'.
  *   Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login.
  *   Select this request: C212861-012225.
  *   Select the 'View Files' button.
  *   You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'.
  *   Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times.
  *   If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire.

Moving forward, we will have a second installment of records ready on or before April 25, 2025.

You have previously indicated you do not wish to use the portal. For future installments, please tell us what format you want to receive the records in. There are several options available outlined here: Fee Schedule<https://www.seattle.gov/public-records/public-records-fee-schedule>. All will include the cost of mailing (actual cost) and the cost of the materials needed to mail.  If we do not hear from you April 25, 2025, we will prepare an invoice for GovQA delivery of $1.25 and, once payment is received, we can make the records available to you.

Please also let us know if you want your records mailed to an alternate address.  If we don’t hear back, we will use the address you provided:
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 179630
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Additionally, we previously asked for clarification around what you meant by staff compensation and benefit records.  As we shared before, we ask our public disclosure staff to self-report on percentage of time spent working on public records and their wage for the year when we begin collecting data for the annual JLARC report.  We have not yet done that which means there are no records specifically reflecting staff compensation for time spent on public disclosure requests available for 2024.  For benefits, you can go here: "Most" Employees Plans - Human Resources | seattle.gov<https://www.seattle.gov/human-resources/benefits/employees-and-covered-family-members/most-employees-plans> and read through the different benefits offered to employees.  If you were seeking different types of records around staff compensation and benefit records, please provide clarification.  If we do not hear back from you on this, we will consider this portion of your request closed.

Sincerely,
Citywide Public Records Act Program
City of Seattle

communications.subject: Seattle Information Technology :: C212861-012225
communications.communication:

Dear , 
Records are now available in response to your request C212861-012225 regarding the following: Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records: 
1. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) detailing costs incurred by your agency in fulfilling records requests, including staff compensation, legal review, and any public records related litigation costs and/or legal settlements for the year 2024 and complete copies of all records request realted fee payments paid to your agency in 2024. 
Responsive public records should include but are not limited to: 
Supplies and services external services (e.g., printing services, large format printing) Mailing costs, supplies (CDs, DVDs, USB sticks, etc.) Staff compensation and benefit records, copies of payments of Public Records Fees Collected, Software licensing, public records portal and database software licensing and costs, purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests, professional services Agency staff costs, copies of billing for all Legal costs – including copies of all litigation Legal settlements related to public records requests litigation of any kind and copies of costs for staff time associated with invoicing and collection. 
The records being made available to you at this time include the following: preliminary JLARC report, litigation costs and staff hours. 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C212861-012225. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
Due to the size and scope of your request, we are providing records to you in installments. We anticipate that the next installment of records will be available on or about April 25, 2025. 
Sincerely, 
Citywide Public Records Act Program 
City of Seattle

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C212861-012225
communications.communication:
Dear , 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C212861-012225 received on January 13, 2025 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV25-C212861-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C212861-012225. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV25-C212861-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Customer Satisfaction Survey - C212861-012225
communications.communication:
RE: Public Disclosure Request Number - C212861-012225 
 
Dear :

title: CPRA Request – Michael Crowe Case Records (January 1998)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CPRA Request – Michael Crowe Case Records (January 1998)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am formally requesting access to all available public records relating to the investigation, prosecution, and subsequent dismissal of charges in the case of Michael Crowe, who was interrogated in January 1998 by the Escondido Police Department in connection with the murder of Stephanie Crowe.

 Requested Records:

1. Case files, charging documents, and dismissal filings related to Michael Crowe and co-defendants in the Stephanie Crowe homicide case.


2. Memos, legal briefs, and notes from the suppression hearing where the confession was deemed coerced.


3. Expert witness reports or psychological assessments of the interrogation techniques used.


4. Correspondence and internal discussions between the DA's Office and Escondido Police Department concerning:

The admissibility of the confession

The decision to file or drop charges

Public/media inquiries


5. Training or policy memos reflecting lessons learned from the Michael Crowe case, if available.


6. Any statements or interviews prepared by the DA's Office regarding the exoneration and later developments in the case.

 Request Details:

Subject: Michael Crowe, then age 14

Incident: Interrogated Jan. 21–23, 1998, for the murder of Stephanie Crowe

Outcome: Conviction thrown out; found factually innocent by a judge in 2012

Jurisdiction: San Diego County, California

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brown Pearl

This letter is in reference to your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request that our office received on April 15, 2025.

Comptroller's Office staff are reviewing the requested contracts. However, due to the volume of FOIL requests this agency is currently processing, staff need more time to complete your request. Accordingly, we anticipate completing our response by or before August 8, 2025. If circumstances arise that necessitate an extension beyond this date, we will notify you.

If you have any questions regarding your request, please send an email to our FOIL Officer at foil@comptroller.nyc.gov<mailto:foil@comptroller.nyc.gov>.

Sincerely,
NYC Comptroller's Office FOIL Unit

communications.subject: RE: FOIL Request - New Submission
communications.communication:
Dear Akash Mehta:



Your Freedom of Information Law ("FOIL") request, dated April 15, 2025, sought the following records from the Office of the New York City Comptroller:



"Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The full text of the following contracts:

CT107120238805437
CT107120238804237
CT107120248807555
CT107120228807358
CT107120238804456
CT107120121416261
CT107120228803428
CT107120228803527
CT107120248807653"



Your request is granted. Copies of the requested contracts are available to download using the secure ShareFile link: https://nyccomptroller.sharefile.com/i/ife70aff683c45c49. The link expires in 30 days.



New York Public Officers Law ("POL") § 87(2)(a) permits an agency to deny access to portions of records that are "specifically exempted from disclosure by state or federal statute." Specifically, under Social Services Law § 136(1), which makes confidential "the names and addresses of persons applying for or receiving public assistance and care" (emphasis added), the names and addresses identifying the location of shelter sites have been redacted from the records.



Furthermore, under N.Y.S. Public Officers Law ("POL") §§ 87(2)(b) and 89(2)(b), the resumes of non-governmental employees have been redacted to prevent an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. See also N.Y.S. POL §§ 89(2)(b)(i) and 89(2)(b)(iv), which states that an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy includes, but shall not be limited to, "disclosure of employment, medical or credit histories or personal references of applicants for employment . . . and disclosure of information of a personal nature when disclosure would result in economic or personal hardship to the subject party and such information is not relevant to the work of the agency requesting or maintaining it."



Under N.Y.S. Public Officers Law § 89(4), you have the right to appeal. Appeals must be submitted within 30 calendar days of receipt of this response and should be submitted by email to FOIL@comptroller.nyc.gov<mailto:FOIL@comptroller.nyc.gov>. Please put "FOIL Appeal" in the email's subject field. Appeals may also be mailed to the following address:



FOIL Appeals Officer

New York City Comptroller's Office

Office of the General Counsel

One Centre Street, Suite 602

New York, NY 10007



If you have any questions regarding your request, please send an email to our FOIL Officer at foil@comptroller.nyc.gov<mailto:foil@comptroller.nyc.gov>.



Sincerely,

NYC Comptroller's Office FOIL Unit
